file_content.text: Nothing for you now. If the Empire needs me, I am here.
Nothing for you now. If the Empire needs me, I am here.
This is Jheeg--I made you into Red Blade, yes? Very little time to talk, very bad news.
How bad is "very bad"?
Bad, huh?
Not good. Very bad.
Jheeg. I wasn't expecting to hear from you again.
This is a surprise.
No. Bad for business, breaking people's cover. I try to not do it, but no choice now.
Spit it out.
Yes. Saying now.
Blade--real Blade--is coming here. Very unexpected, very sudden. On a shuttle to Jiguuna right now.
All right. How do you suggest I respond?
We need a plan.
You told me the real Blade was far away. What's he found out?
He knows about me?
You're right--this is bad.
Ouch.
I am looking for why Blade comes here, where Blade comes from. Perhaps Blade is told about your cover. Sorry.
Blade's trip is still mostly secret. Kill Blade quickly in the shuttle bay, no one knows.
Got it.
Yes. I have warned you. Done my part.
I don't like killing, Jheeg.
That's murder.
Then I have no advice.
This is your fault, Jheeg. It was your job to handle this.
I blame you.
No one at fault, except maybe Red Blade.
Good luck. Goodbye. Tell your handler that Jheeg serves well.
Nothing for you now. If the Empire needs me, I am here.
Nothing for you now. If the Empire needs me, I am here.
I contacted Imperial handlers. As assured, yes? The call is arriving now.
Jheeg. From this point forward, operational security will be at a premium. You will not contact us from this terminal again.
Yes. Leaving for your privacy. I will await contact.
I understand you corrected Jheeg's mishandling of the situation, agent. We'll now proceed.
Proceed to do what, exactly?
Proceed?
Yes, sir.
That creature didn't just "mishandle" things. He messed up badly.
Jheeg should be punished.
Possibly. But we will use him until he's outlived his function.
Your next task is to access Nem'ro's inner circle. Present yourself to the Hutt as a fellow gangster--the Red Blade--and offer him Jheeg's gifts.
One of the gifts is implanted with a listening device, which we will use to monitor conversations within Nem'ro's palace.
Are you listening for something specific?
I think I get it.
If someone suspects me, what should I do?
What if there's trouble?
Use your judgment--silence them or allay their suspicions, as appropriate. But keep this in mind:
Seems pointless.
Watch your tone, and stay focused.
At this juncture, our primary goal is to find weaknesses in Nem'ro's organization. Even if the Hutt won't join us, we might influence his lieutenants.
Talk to Nem'ro and his men. Determine who we can turn and how we can sway them. We will be listening.
In that case, I better watch my mouth.
Enjoy the show.
I expect my ears can handle it, "Blade."
I'm on it.
Whatever it takes to get me off this slime-pit of a world.
I just want to be done.
There are far worse places, "Blade." Enjoy this while it lasts.
Be careful what you say--and lose the accent. When you're in the Hutt palace, you're no longer an Imperial.
Contact me from the cantina once Nem'ro has his "presents." Keeper out.
All witnesses eliminated? Gifts recovered. I will examine.
Good. Many things Nem'ro wants, things Nem'ro likes. Once Nem'ro has his gifts, all his suspicions go away. You become a pirate. You become Red Blade.
What exactly are these "gifts"?
"Gifts"?
Frivolous, expensive. Aurodium idols from Republic royalty. Tarul wine from Naboo. Tomuon wool Hutt robes.
You've done well. The Empire is grateful to you.
Excellent work.
Yes. The Empire shows its gratitude generously.
I had to kill people for those gifts, Jheeg. This had better work.
That was a lot of trouble.
I believe this. All will succeed.
Preferring not to be seen with you until you have eliminated gang to recover Nem'ro's gifts. For safety.
You. You are here softly, from the Empire. I am Jheeg. I am expecting you. I have your new identity.
How'd an alien on Hutta end up working for the Empire?
What's your story?
They offer me money. Much like you? Now, I am helping another Imperial alien.
They offer me money. I agree to take money. Very good arrangement. Now, I am helping you.
Let's hear it.
Talk fast. I don't want to be seen with you.
This isn't safe.
Very fast. Very good.
You know the Red Blade? Small-time pirate. Rich. Mysterious. No one knows true species, gender, color.
I planted rumors, made Nem'ro think the Red Blade is coming to visit--enjoy Hutt palace, do business. You will be the Blade. No one will doubt you.
What'll I have to do?
How's this work?
If there's another Red Blade out there, won't that be a problem?
What about the real Blade?
No. Real Blade is far away now, looking for new trade in the Outer Rim. Out of contact; won't cause trouble.
This sounds easy, Jheeg. What's the catch?
Too simple.
Yes. Catch is unfortunate. I will explain.
Real Blade brings tribute to friends; brings presents, bribes. Real Blade is far away, now, exploring the Outer Rim; won't cause trouble.
Only one concern: I arranged tribute for Nem'ro, gifts imported from Empire, but there was--interference?--at spaceport.
What kind of interference?
Interference?
I'm not going to like this, am I?
That's bad.
Very likely, no.
Hurry up.
Gang steals from docks. Dangerous men, unaware of us. Nem'ro's tribute taken. But I saw everything--I observed well, yes?
I have proposed solution: You quickly eliminate gang members. Only method to recover gifts, remove witnesses.
Let's make this fast and quiet, then.
I'll handle it.
Gangsters are nearby--this is why we meet here. But advise significant caution. Targets are excellent shots.
They'll probably sell what they stole. What if we made them an offer?
Could we buy the gifts back?
Too much attention, too many questions. My orders were soft--yours, too. Elimination is reliable.
In other words, you messed up and want me to fix things.
This is your mistake.
Situation is regrettable. My job is to watch and speak, not protect cargo.
Gangsters are nearby--why we meet here, yes? But advise discretion, caution. Targets are excellent shots.
I will communicate plan to our handlers. Speak again once Nem'ro's tribute has been recovered.
I am not expecting you. No talk, yes?
